medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 2 weeks prior to presentation with the development of a tender lump at the posterior base of the neck. Two days before presentation, fever (39.4Â°C), mild headache, myalgias, chills, and fatigue developed. Ibuprofen was taken without improvement.
medical_history.past_medical_history: He had a history of low hemoglobin levels but was otherwise healthy. He had a negative tuberculin skin test in the past and had not received the influenza vaccine during the previous year.
medical_history.family_history: His parents had diabetes mellitus; no family history of autoimmune or connective-tissue diseases was mentioned.
medical_history.social_history: He was born in India, moved to the U.S. 4 years ago for school, and last visited India 6 months prior. He worked in an office, lived with a roommate, was not sexually active, stopped smoking 2 years ago, drank alcohol occasionally, and did not use illicit drugs.
